House On Telegraph Hill (1951) Richard Basehart, William Lundigan, Valentina Cortese - Film Noir Full Movie
sources.description: House on Telegraph Hill is a 1951 American film noir directed by Robert Wise, and starring Richard Basehart, Valentina Cortese, and William Lundigan. Fay Baker also stars in the film, which received an Academy Award nomination for its art direction. The hill in the title is San Francisco's Telegraph Hill, where much of the story takes place. Of personal interest, Basehart and the Italian actress Cortese met for the first time on this film, and fell in love and married. Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_House_on_Telegraph_Hill Suggested Film Noirs: http://bit.ly/2tLevkl The Internet Archive is an excellent choice for entire full length Netflix & YouTube style uploads of drama, mystery, thriller & crime noir movies from the UK & USA for free. sources.title: The House on Telegraph Hill (1951)
sources.description: Concentration camp survivor Victoria Kowelska finds herself involved in mystery, greed, and murder when she assumes the identity of a dead friend in order to gain passage to America. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/the-house-on-telegraph-hill-1951/

metadata.Plot: Victoria has survived Nazi concentration by assuming the identity of one who died there. She arrives in San Francisco to see her "son" just as the boy's great-aunt dies leaving a lot of money to be inherited. Victoria falls in love with the boy's trustee Alan Spender, and they move into the mansion on Telegraph Hill. Living life in a new identity isn't without its dangers, however.
metadata.Writer: Elick Moll, Frank Partos, Dana Lyon
metadata.Actors: Richard Basehart, Valentina Cortese, William Lundigan
